Federal Guidance Updates

  • Category of Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) Agency U.S. Department of the Treasury
    U.S. Department of the Treasury, IRS Release Final Rules to Ensure Good-Paying Clean Energy Jobs, Expand Clean Energy Workforce As Part of President Biden’s Investing in America Agenda published Jun 18, 2024

    On June 18, the U.S. Department of the Treasury and the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) released final rules on prevailing wage and registered apprenticeship (PWA) requirements in the Inflation Reduction Act.

  • Category of Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) Agency Internal Revenue Service
    Treasury, IRS release guidance for the Energy Community Bonus Credit under the Inflation Reduction Act published Jun 7, 2024

    On June 7, US Treasury and the IRS released guidance that taxpayers and Elective Pay participants may use to determine whether they meet certain requirements for purposes of qualifying for the Energy Community Bonus Credit.

  • Category of Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) Agency U.S. Department of the Treasury
    U.S. Department of the Treasury, IRS Release Additional Guidance to Boost American Clean Energy Manufacturing published May 16, 2024

    On May 16, the U.S. Department of the Treasury and Internal Revenue Service (IRS) released additional guidance on the IRA’s domestic content bonus, part of President Biden’s economic strategy to boost American manufacturing and iron and steel production, so American workers and companies can continue to build the clean energy economy.

  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency U.S. Department of Transportation
    FRA Makes More Than $2 Billion in New Funding Available to Continue Improving America’s Busiest Passenger Rail Corridor published May 14, 2024

    On May 14, U.S. DOT’s Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) released a funding opportunity that makes available over $2 billion in Federal-State Partnership for Intercity Passenger Rail Program funding for projects located on the Northeast Corridor.

  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency Department of Energy
    Department of Energy Releases Final Interpretive Guidance on the Definition of Foreign Entity of Concern published May 03, 2024

    On May 3, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) finalized its guidance interpreting the statutory definition of “foreign entity of concern” (FEOC) in Section 40207 of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL)
